strategy.trend_analysis: The strategy incorporates trending 'StudyTok' and 'EduTok' hashtags to tap into established educational communities. It also leverages popular, broad terms like #Dragons and #Comedy for wider discoverability, while maintaining specific #Calculus and #MathEducation tags for targeted reach. 'MidtermReview' and 'FinalsWeek' are included to capitalize on seasonal academic relevance.
strategy.engagement_strategy: Engagement is driven through a mix of questions (#WhatIsContinuity), direct calls to action (#AskACalculusDragon), and community-focused tags (#ShareYourKnowledge, #InstaLearn). The unique 'Smooth Dragon Flights' and 'DragonCalculus' tags also serve as community builders, encouraging consistent use and recognition.

usage_tips: On Instagram, aim to use a mix of 15-25 hashtags. Place them either at the end of your caption or in the first comment to keep the caption clean.
Vary your hashtag usage across posts to avoid being flagged as spam. Rotate through the broad and trending categories.
For Instagram Reels, prioritize trending audio and visual hashtags alongside the educational ones.
Monitor the performance of each hashtag to see which ones are driving the most impressions and engagement. Adjust your strategy accordingly.
Consider creating a branded hashtag like #SmoothDragonFlights and encouraging your audience to use it when discussing the content or related topics.

generation_metadata.topic: EPISODE 8: Smooth Dragon Flights!! Show this as HUGE ANIMATED TITLE CARD at the beginning for 3 seconds with epic effects! Create a Family Guy style comedy where dragon pilot teaches function limits and continuity. Cover epsilon-delta definition, one-sided limits, Cauchy criterion, continuity conditions, types of discontinuities, and the intermediate value theorem. Use visual metaphors: smooth flying vs teleporting, landing from different directions, altitude changes. Make limits and continuity intuitive through flight analogies.
